channel.description: a collection of how-to guides and demonstrations for building shiny apps

item.title: Setting Document Attributes
item.description: When evaluating Shiny applications in terms of web accessibility, assessment tools will always throw an error: 'Document language missing'. Shiny does not set this attribute and others like it by default. In this tutorial, we will learn how to fix this.
item.dc:creator: @dcruvolo

item.title: Get Window Dimensions
item.description: Learn how to retrieve window dimensions and use them in the Shiny server. You probably will never need to use window dimensions in R, but this tutorial demonstrates how to send data from JavaScript to R.
item.dc:creator: @dcruvolo

item.title: Drag and Drop Example
item.description: Drag and drop elements may be useful for advanced user interactivity. You can use draggable elements in many situations, such as allowing users to personalize the UI. In this tutorial, learn how to create a draggable element and the required javscript events.
item.dc:creator: @dcruvolo
